directions: In a large frying pan heat the butter over moderately low heat. Season pork with salt and pepper.

Raise heat to medium and add the chops to the pan and saut√© for 7 minutes. Turn and cook until chops are browned and done to medium, about 7-8 minutes longer. Remove the chops and put in a warm spot.

Add the onion to the pan and cook, stirring, until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the stock and boil until it reduces to 1/2 cup, about 3 minutes. Stir in the mustard, herbs, and 1/8 tsp pepper. Put the chops on a platter and pour the sauce over the meat.
ingredients: 4 pork chops (22 oz with bone, fat removed), 1 inch thick, trim all visible fat
2 tbsp chopped, fresh herbs like parsley, chives
title: Pork Chops with Dijon Herb Sauce
